properties.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued January 18 at 3:34PM EST until January 20 at 4:00AM EST by NWS Cleveland OH
properties.description:
...Heavy Lake Effect Snow Expected...

.Lake effect snow is expected to develop tonight after a cold front
moves east across the area, ushering in a seasonably cold airmass.
The heaviest lake effect snow is expected to occur during the day
Sunday, producing up to 6 to 10 inches across Erie County, PA.
Elsewhere in the primary snowbelt can anticipate 3 to 5 inches of
snow. Widespread wind gusts of 30 to 40 mph with locally higher
gusts near the lakeshore will produce blowing snow and reduced
visibilities.

* WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations
of 6 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph with locally
higher gusts near the lakeshore.

* WHERE...Erie county.

* WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 4 AM EST Monday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could
bring down tree branches.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The previous Winter Weather Advisory for
mixed precipitation was cancelled due to precipitation changing to
all rain.
The heaviest lake effect snow is expected to occur during the day
Sunday. Widespread wind gusts of 30 to 40 mph with locally higher
gusts near the lakeshore will produce blowing snow and reduced
visibilities.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania
Turnpike Commission strongly encourage motorists to heed all
travel restrictions and delay unnecessary travel. Visit
www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic
conditions.

NWSheadline: LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 4 AM EST MONDAY
HazardType: Heavy Lake Effect Snow, Lake Effect Snow
